positions.title: Whiteboard Federal Technologies
positions.description:
Key developer on a small team driving the full life cycle development of a mission critical, high availability, big data application from inception to production. This system was praised as "the most relevant and impactful initiative" by the customer and achieved annual savings of $50M beyond target due to improved software and process efficiency. Improved UI/UX and promoted software componentization by designing and implementing an extensible widget framework. Enhanced software scalability by architecting and implementing an asynchronous task executor for long running jobs against large data sets. Active committer to a shared framework which provides data versioning, field-level sourcing, workflows, visualization, alerting, and search. Adhering to TDD and Agile principles, develop and regularly release software using Java, Spring, MarkLogic, XQuery, XSLT, JQuery, JavaScript, HTML, CSS, JUnit, Jenkins, Ant.

Ben is an excellent developer who actively seeks out new technologies and approaches while consistently meeting or exceeding customer expectations. He is always willing to accept new challenges. Customer satisfaction is always part of our discussions.

I am honored to have the opportunity to share a few words about Ben. Ben is truly an exceptional individual that any organization doing work in the advanced software engineering field would aspire to have on their team. Ben is grounded in the fundamentals of technology – it goes beyond his profession to his personal passion and individual hobbies. I wouldn’t be at all surprised if Ben dreams about complex software engineering problems and how to write the perfect code to deliver a functional and elegant solution on time and under budget. Every introduction that we made on Ben’s behalf came back with rave reviews. Beyond software Ben has strong personal values – he is an unwavering team player – he is appreciated at the highest level by the customers he supports and he can smell a business opportunity with the slightest waft of a new challenge on a project. If I was building a software product or software engineering company, Ben would be at the top of my list as “must hires” – he is undoubtedly in the top 1% of his field!
